step1.sentence: Landing her first research grant was a great achievement that opened many doors for her career.

step2.story: After years of failed experiments and sleepless nights, Dr. Park finally published her breakthrough paper on renewable energy. Her colleagues called it a great achievement that would reshape the entire field. She smiled quietly, knowing the real reward was the knowledge itself.

step3.story: Minho had always been an average student, never standing out in any particular subject. When his teacher suggested he enter the national science competition, he almost laughed it off. But something pushed him to try, and he spent every evening after school building his project from scratch. On the day of the finals, his hands trembled as he presented his solar-powered water filter to the judges. When they announced his name as the winner, the auditorium erupted in applause. His mother wiped tears from her eyes and whispered that it was the greatest achievement she had ever witnessed.

meaning.realUsageKo: 누군가가 오랜 노력 끝에 의미 있는 결과를 이뤄냈을 때 사용합니다. 학업, 직장, 개인적 목표 등 다양한 맥락에서 폭넓게 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'great'는 고대 영어 'grēat(큰, 거대한)'에서, 'achievement'는 프랑스어 'achever(완성하다)'에서 유래했습니다. 두 단어가 결합되어 '완성해낸 큰 일'이라는 의미를 형성합니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 성공보다 더 무게감 있는 표현으로, 상당한 노력이나 어려움을 극복한 결과에 대해 쓰입니다. 격식체와 일상 대화 모두에서 자연스럽게 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Graduating from medical school was a great achievement for the entire family.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 의대를 졸업한 것은 온 가족에게 위대한 업적이었다.
